Class: StaggeredIsometric

map/staggered-isometric. StaggeredIsometric

new StaggeredIsometric(tileData, hitTests, clientWidth, clientHeight, stats)

Represents a map of type 'staggered' created with the tiled map editor.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
tileData Object The map's data, parsed from the JSON exported map data.
hitTests Object An object of keys and values where the keys are image names and the values are image paths that should be preloaded. These are the hit test image maps.
clientWidth Number The width of the canvas client area
clientHeight Number The height of the canvas client area
stats Object <optional>
 An object that will receive new properties representing runtime statistics, for debug purposes.

Members

clientHeight :Number

The canvas height

clientWidth :Number

The canvas width

Methods

getTile(c, r) → {Object}

Get a tile by it's row and column position in the original map data.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
layer. Object The layer to search for tiles.
c Number The column, aka x position in the data.
r Number the row, aka y position in the data.
Returns:
A tile, or null if the input was out of range.
Type
Object

getTilePropsAtTilePos(prop, x, y) → {String|Array}

Takes a tile position and returns a property value as defined by the tiles. Tiles are checked from the top-most layer down until a tile is found that holds that property. This means that top-most tiles can override property values from lower tiles.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
prop String | Array The property or properties to get.
x Number A tile x column position
y Number A tile y row position
Returns:
The property value, or undefined if not found. If the prop parameter was an array, the return value will be an object describing all the properties required.
Type
String | Array

getTilePropsAtWorldPos(prop, x, y) → {String|Object}

Takes a world position and returns a property value as defined by the tiles underneath that coordinate. Tiles are checked from the top-most layer down until a tile is found that holds that property. This means that top-most tiles can override property values from lower tiles.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
prop String | Array The property or properties to get
x Number A world x position
y Number A world y position
Returns:
The property value, or undefined if not found. If the prop parameter was an array, the return value will be an object describing all the requested properties.
Type
String | Object

getWorldEdges() → {Object}

Gets an object describing the pixel limits of the world edges.
Returns:
Contains 4 properties, le, te, re and be which hold the left, top, right and bottom edges respectively.
Type
Object

groundLayer() → {Number}

Finds the index of the ground layer.
Returns:
The index of the ground layer.
Type
Number

insertLayer(idx, layer)

Inserts a new layer into the layer list.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
idx Number The index to insert the layer at.
layer Object The layer to insert. Normally created via a layer plugin.

primePreloader(preloader)

Primes a preloader with the images required for a map (I.e. the tiles).
Parameters:
Name Type Description
preloader Object A preloader object.

screenToTilePos(x, y, out) → {Number}

Takes a screen position and tells you what tile it lies on. Take care with the return value, the function signature is all backwards.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number A screen x position
y Number A screen y position
out Array A 2-length array that will recieve the tile x/y position in its 0/1 values.
Returns:
The distance from the given screen position to the closest tile edge, capped at 127px.
Type
Number

screenToWorldPos(out)

Convert a screen coordinate to a world coordinate.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
out Array Returned values via passed-in array. Must be 2-length. Order is x,y

scroll(dx, dy)

Scrolls the map by a given amound in pixels, limited to the set map bounds.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
dx Number The X amount to scroll by
dy Number The Y amount to scroll by

scrollTo(x, y)

Scrolls the map to the given world coordinate, limited to the set map bounds.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number The X world position to scroll to
y Number The Y world position to scroll to

setTilePropAtTilePos(prop, val, x, y)

Takes a tile position and sets a property value on the topmost tile at a given tile position. If no tile is found, no property is set.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
prop String | Object The property to set, or an object that contains a set of properties to set on the tile.
val * <optional>
 The property value. Ignored if prop is an object.
x Number A tile x column position
y Number A tile y row position

tileDimensions(out)

Returns the dimensions of one tile. Return value is via a 2-length spanned array passed in as an output parameter.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
out Array An array of length 2 that will receive the tile dimensions, x then y.

worldToScreenPos(out)

Convert a world coordinate to a screen coordinate.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
out Array Returned values via passed-in array. Must be 2-length. Order is x,y

worldToTilePos(x, y, out) → {Number}

Takes a world position and tells you what tile it lies on. Take care with the return value, the function signature is all backwards.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
x Number A world x position
y Number A world y position
out Array A 2-length array that will recieve the tile x/y position in its 0/1 values.
Returns:
The distance from the given world position to the closest tile edge, capped at 127px.
Type
Number
